alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Spencer; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 12:35AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A band of showers with strong winds will impact portions of northeastern Warrick, northeastern Spencer, northeastern Gibson and Pike Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1134 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a band of showers with strong winds near Dale, or 21 miles northeast of Boonville, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Warrick, northeastern Spencer, northeastern Gibson and Pike Counties, including the following locations... Spurgeon and Ferdinand. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 34 and 48. Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 47 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
